October 16, 1954
Mr. Jasaes E. Taylor
Director of Television
De Paul University
64 East Lake Street
Chicago 1, Illinois
Dear Mr. Taylor1
I am very happy to Inform you officially that the Board of Directors of the NA2B
has approved your application in behalf of the De Paul University for associate
membership in our association*
You will now be receiving regularly from us the monthly NAIB hevaletter» various
additional publications of interest as they are published, and many other items.
You should, of course, feel free to write to us at any tine for any information
you would like concerning educational broadcasting. We will always try to help.
Enclosed you find a list of the materials available from the KAEB. Please
let us know which of these you would like to receive and we will send them to
you. Under separate cover we are sending you a Director of Members. Your cer¬
tificate of membership will be sent to you soon.
Perhaps the greatest good of an NAEB membership is the associations you form. Itfs
good to know that others are having the same problems as you and how they are
solving them. It has been the tradition with NAEB, in its thirty years are the
association of educators who broadcast, to exchange this sort of information on
a friend—to-friend basis. You will find l&ts of friends in the NAEB, and lots of
people with good advice and good staff resources to supplement those which you
have.
Sincerely,
Harry J. Skomia
